From the zoo package (<https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/zoo/index.html>)
```
# carry the last observation forward to replace NAs
d$'Well.No.' <- zoo::na.locf(d$'Well.No.')
```

Update June 5, 2023: `tidyr` has functions that are easier to use and don't require an extra package: `tidyr::fill()`
